t: Psalm 44
Come to Our Help
To the choirmaster. A Maskil of the Sons of Korah.
O*pn God, we have heard with our ears, our*ld fathers have told us, what*ln deeds you performed in their days, in*ld the days of old:
you*ln with your own hand drove out the nations, but*ld them you planted; you*ln afflicted the peoples, but*ld them you set free;
for*ln not by their own sword did they win the land, nor*ld did their own arm save them, but*ln your right hand and your arm, and*ld the light of your face, for*ld you delighted in them.
You*pn are my King, O God; ordain*ld salvation for Jacob!
Through*ln you we push down our foes; through*ld your name we tread down those who rise up against us.
For*ln not in my bow do I trust, nor*ld can my sword save me.
But*ln you have saved us from our foes and*ld have put to shame those who hate us.
In*ln God we have boasted continually, and*ld we will give thanks to your name forever. Selah*ig
But*pn you have rejected us and disgraced us and*ld have not gone out with our armies.
You*ln have made us turn back from the foe, and*ld those who hate us have gotten spoil.
You*ln have made us like sheep for slaughter and*ld have scattered us among the nations.
You*ln have sold your people for a trifle, demanding*ld no high price for them.
You*ln have made us the taunt of our neighbors, the*ld derision and scorn of those around us.
You*ln have made us a byword among the nations, a*ld laughingstock among the peoples.
All*ln day long my disgrace is before me, and*ld shame has covered my face
at*ln the sound of the taunter and reviler, at*ld the sight of the enemy and the avenger.
All*pn this has come upon us, though*ld we have not forgotten you, and*ld we have not been false to your covenant.
Our*ln heart has not turned back, nor*ld have our steps departed from your way;
yet*ln you have broken us in the place of jackals and*ld covered us with the shadow of death.
If*ln we had forgotten the name of our God or*ld spread out our hands to a foreign god,
would*ln not God discover this? For*ld he knows the secrets of the heart.
Yet*ln for your sake we are killed all the day long; we*ld are regarded as sheep to be slaughtered.
Awake!*pn Why are you sleeping, O Lord? Rouse*ld yourself! Do not reject us forever!
Why*ln do you hide your face? Why*ld do you forget our affliction and oppression?
For*ln our soul is bowed down to the dust; our*ld belly clings to the ground.
Rise*ln up; come to our help! Redeem*ld us for the sake of your steadfast love!
